alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Greene; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 11:00AM EST until January 07 at 7:45PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Oconee, Clarke and Greene Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 15 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into fields...woodlands and pastures...mainly on the right bank of the river...upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Saturday was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 7.3 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
